Context:
The Building Renovation Technology advanced diploma program offered at George Brown College includes instruction in installation and finishing, site management, cabinetry, stair construction, building code, basics in electrical, HVAC, and plumbing systems, estimating, and safety. Students are required to complete semester 2 in the summer of the same year to continue into semester 3 in the fall. The program offers two field placement opportunities in semesters 3 and 4. Career options for graduates include renovation, general contracting, custom home building, carpentry, site supervision, estimating, technical sales, and home inspections. Students who complete this program may be eligible to enter the third year of the Honours Bachelor of Technology (Construction Management) degree program.

Semester 1 courses include Residential Construction Lab 1, Plan Interpretation 1, Construction Safety, Communicating Across Contexts, Mathematics for Building Technologies 1, a General Education Elective, and Portfolio. Semester 2 courses are Estimating 1, Building Science and Green Construction, Plan Interpretation 2, Residential Construction Lab 2, Mathematics for Building Technologies, and Portfolio.

Note: Students who start the program in Winter term will take first and second semester courses in alternatively delivered formats.

Context:
The text provides information on the building and renovation programs offered by George Brown College, along with tuition fees and admission requirements. Here is the extracted information:

Program Details:
- Complete building and renovation stages in accordance with blueprint specifications and conservation principles
- Select materials and equipment for appropriate application to building construction and renovation projects
- Schedule and monitor progression of projects using project management principles
- Apply business principles to operation of building construction and/or renovation enterprise

Tuition Fees:
- Domestic students (Fall 2023): $4,106.00 (estimated total for first two semesters)
- International students (Fall 2023): $18,143.00 (estimated total for first two semesters)
- Note: Tuition fees are subject to change and do not include books which must be purchased separately

Admission Requirements:
- Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent
- Grade 12 English (C or U)
- Grade 11 Math (M or U) or grade 12 (C or U)
- Mature students may take Admissions Assessment for English and Math, or consider upgrading to achieve required credits in English and Math.

OSAP Funding: The program is approved for OSAP funding for eligible applicants.

Context:
To apply for a program at George Brown College:
- Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges.
- International students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System and visit the How to Apply page for more information.
- For country-specific admission requirements, international students can visit the International Admissions page.
- Applicants may need to have grades higher than the minimum requirements stated.
- Course exemptions are possible based on college or university credits. More information can be found on the Transfer Guide.
- Information sessions and campus tours can be booked for more information about the programs.

Contact Information:
- School of Apprenticeship and Skilled Trades: Phone: 416-415-5000, ext. 6711, Email: skilledtrades@georgebrown.ca, Office: Casa Loma Campus, Room E308
- Contact Centre: 416-415-2000 (TTY 1-877-515-5559) or long distance 1-800-265-2002
- International contact representatives: booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry on the International Contact Us page.
